{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Arris |model=MG2402G |revision=/CT |series=N900 |asin= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=DareGlobal |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=now |fcc_date=06/19/2013 |fcc_id=UID2402GCT |ic_id=6670A-2402GCT |pcb_id=ARCT03131 |type=wireless router, cable modem, analog phone gateway, |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=5.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Intel Puma |cpu1_model=DHCE2652 |cpu1_cspeed=1.2 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |cpu2_brand=Ralink |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=64 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model=NAND |fla2=16 |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=Micron |ram1_model= |ram1_num=4 |ram2=128 |ram2_brand=Hynix |ram2_model= |ram2_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0, eSATA, |expansion_usb_num=2 |expansion_sata_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Celeno |wi1_chip1_model=CLR260 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Celeno |wi2_chip1_model=CLR260 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Realtek |sw_model=RTL8367RB |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags=DOCSIS 3.0, MoCA 2.0, SD Card slot, Cable Card, DECT, ZigBee, battery backup, |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|Touchstone MG2402G/CT Media Gateway}} :[https://www.arris.com/globalassets/resources/data-sheets/mg2402_ts_05jun13.pdf Datasheet] {{•}} [http://www.ncube.com/product_catalog/_docs/_specsheet/MG2402_TS_05JUN13.pdf Datasheet]
"PCB MADE IN CHINA", "ARRIS", "© 2013", and "ARRIS Group, Inc." :is silkscreened on the top of the board in the FCC photos. "ARCT03131" and "REV E" is on the bottom of the board :in the PCMCIA / Cable Card slot region.
*DOCSIS 3.0 24x8 channels<!--
-->{{CableModemSpec |down_c=24 |up_c=8 }}
External photos show an ''Xfinity'' branded device, :indicating probable use with ''{{Used by service|Comcast}}'''s service.
===Specifications=== Additional chips used / more detailed P/Ns, per the FCC photos, follow... *[[ZigBee]]: [http://www.greenpeak.com/company/PressReleases/PR-GP710.html ''GreenPeak'' GP710] (GP710C4DGP?), [http://www.greenpeak.com/Press/PressKit/GP710ProductBrochure.pdf PBrief] *DECT: [http://www.dspg.com/english/Product.aspx?CatalogId=4&CategoryID=13&SubCategoryID=24&ProductId=98 ''DSP Group'' DCX81] *MoCA: some ''Entropic Communications'' chip
Additional specifications, per the datasheet linked to above, follows... *Battery backup **8-hour targeted run time **2lbs (0.91kg) Li-ion battery w/ 4.4AH capacity **Storage temperature: -4°F to 140°F (-20°C to 60°C) **''Storage above 77°F (25°C) will significantly ::reduce the life of the battery!'' *Dimensions: [[Dimensions::295 mm x 10 mm x 100 mm]] *Weight: 3.1lbs w/ no battery, ~ [[Weight::5.1 lbs]] w/ battery *Operating temperature: 41°F to 104°F (5°C to 40°C)
[http://www.celeno.com/products/clr260.html '''Celeno-Ralink''' CLR260 Product page] :Both of the CL260s are using ''SiGe'' ([[Skyworks]]) PAM/FEMs :*The 2.4GHz radio ''appears'' to be using [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=1505 SE2620T] :*The 5GHz radio ''appears'' to be using [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=973 SE5012T]
__NOTOC__
